activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pat H Mickley

records.addlTxt:
1:27 PM Defendant Pat H Mickley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Pat H Mickley. 
State requests bond and bond modification in 22CF123.
22CF123-Court orders bond modification from no abusive contact to no contact with P.M. 
Attorney Rockow & DE in breakout room.
1:35 PM Attorney Rockow & DE back from breakout room.
Attorney Rockow waives further reading and enters NG plea.
Attorney Rockow relates to bond. 
State relates to bond.
Bond set. 
Next hearing to be in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must have no contact with P.M. or the address of (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL).  May go one time with law enforcement to obtain personal items. 
May not possess any firearms.

06/08/2022 THIS BOND IS AMENDED TO DELETE THE CONDITION OF "(ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL)"  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

07/21/22 COURT MODIFIES BOND TO "MUST HAVE NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH P.M. AND DELETES THE PORTION WHICH PROHIBITS DEFENDANT FROM RETURNING TO THE RESIDENCE AT (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL).

10/12/22 COURT MODIFIES BOND TO "MUST HAVE NO CONTACT WITH P.M."  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Order for release of firearms. 

CC: BC Sheriff's Dept.; sent copy to Mathew Motzer on 10/10/22 and advised DA office to send copy to Sheriff's Dept

3:12 PM Defendant Pat H Mickley not in court. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow not in court.   Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom telephone means. 
Mathew Motzer appears and requests return of firearms. Mr. Motzer relates. State does not object. Court orders the firearms belonging to Mathew Motzer. be returned. Court will prepare the order.
Petition from M.M. for return of firearms.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 22, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  JT 12/22/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 12/15/22.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must have no contact with P.M. or the address of (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL).  May go one time with law enforcement to obtain personal items. 
May not possess any firearms.

06/08/2022 THIS BOND IS AMENDED TO DELETE THE CONDITION OF "(ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL)"  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

07/21/22 COURT MODIFIES BOND TO "MUST HAVE NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH P.M. AND DELETES THE PORTION WHICH PROHIBITS DEFENDANT FROM RETURNING TO THE RESIDENCE AT (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL).

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pat H Mickley in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Pat H Mickley. Attorney Rockow relates and moves to modify bond.  State relates and does not object.  Court orders bond be modified to must have no abusive contact and deletes portion which prohibits DE from returning to residence.
Notice from Embrace to drop the no-contact condition on the bond.

11:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pat H Mickley in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Pat H Mickley. 
11:44 Sgt. Vincent Graf, Barron County Sheriff Department, called, sworn and direct by State.
11:49 No cross.
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
Defendant must appear in person at Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must have no contact with P.M. or the address of (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL). May go one time with law enforcement to obtain personal items. 
May not possess any firearms.

06/08/2022 THIS BOND IS AMENDED TO DELETE THE CONDITION OF "NO CONTACT WITH (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL)."  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pat H Mickley in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Pat H Mickley. 
Formal reading of Complaint waived. Preliminary hearing requested. Time limits are waived. May appear by zoom video. 
Clerk to provide zoom information after leaving court today. 
State requests bond modification. Court orders the no contact with the residence be removed from the bond conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must have no contact with P.M. or the address of (ADDRESS CONFIDENTIAL). May go one time with law enforcement to obtain personal items. 
May not possess any firearms.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pat H Mickley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Pat H Mickley. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. Must appear in person. Must contact the SPD office today.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
